info.title: Payment Method Tokens
info.description:
The Payment Method Tokens API saves payment methods so payers don't have to enter details for future transactions. Payers can check out faster or pay without being present after they agree to save a payment method.

The API associates a payment method with a temporary setup token. Pass the setup token to the API to exchange the setup token for a permanent token.

The permanent token represents a payment method that's saved to the vault. This token can be used repeatedly for checkout or recurring transactions such as subscriptions.

post.description: Creates a Payment Token from the given payment source and adds it to the Vault of the associated customer.
post.summary: Create payment token for a given payment source

tags.name: payment-tokens
tags.description: Use the `/vault/payment-tokens` resource to create, retrieve, and delete a payment token that may optionally be associated with a customer.

tags.name: setup-tokens
tags.description: Use the `/vault/setup-tokens` resource to create and retrieve temporary vault payment methods.

tags.name: tokens
tags.description: Use the `/vault/tokens` resource to detokenize a vault token to retrieve details associated to the underlying payment source.

tags.name: customers
tags.description: Use the `/vault/customers` resource to create, update, get and delete a customer.

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/vault/pa: Permission to only read from vault

paypal_request_id.name: PayPal-Request-Id
paypal_request_id.description: The server stores keys for 3 hours.

customer_id.name: customer_id
customer_id.description: A unique identifier representing a specific customer in merchant's/partner's system or records.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: A non-negative, non-zero integer indicating the maximum number of results to return at one time.

page.name: page
page.description: A non-negative, non-zero integer representing the page of the results.

total_required.name: total_required
total_required.description: A boolean indicating total number of items (total_items) and pages (total_pages) are expected to be returned in the response.

error_details.title: Error Details
error_details.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

error_400.title: Bad Request Error
error_400.description: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

enum: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_401.title: Unauthorized Error
error_401.description: Authentication failed due to missing Authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

enum: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_403.title: Not Authorized Error
error_403.description: The client is not authorized to access this resource, although it may have valid credentials.

enum: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_404.title: Not found Error
error_404.description: The server has not found anything matching the request URI. This either means that the URI is incorrect or the resource is not available.

enum: The specified resource does not exist.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_409.title: Resource Conflict Error
error_409.description: The server has detected a conflict while processing this request.

enum: The server has detected a conflict while processing this request.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_415.title: Unsupported Media Type Error
error_415.description: The server does not support the request payload's media type.

enum: The server does not support the request payload's media type.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_422.title: Unprocessable Entity Error
error_422.description: The requested action cannot be performed and may require interaction with APIs or processes outside of the current request. This is distinct from a 500 response in that there are no systemic problems limiting the API from performing the request.

enum: The requested action could not be performed, semantically incorrect, or failed business validation.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_500.title: Internal Server Error
error_500.description: This is either a system or application error, and generally indicates that although the client appeared to provide a correct request, something unexpected has gone wrong on the server.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

error_503.title: Service Unavailable Error
error_503.description: The server is temporarily unable to handle the request, for example, because of planned maintenance or downtime.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

merchant_partner_customer_id.description: The unique ID for a customer generated by PayPal.

customer.title: Customer Request
customer.description: Customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

id.description: The unique ID for a customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

vault_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the vault token.

card_brand.title: Card Brand
card_brand.description: The card network or brand. Applies to credit, debit, gift, and payment cards.

date_year_month.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

date_time.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

currency_code.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/api/rest/reference/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

money.title: Money
money.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/api/rest/reference/currency-codes/).

processor_response.title: Processor Response
processor_response.description: The processor information. Might be required for payment requests, such as direct credit card transactions.

avs_code.description: The address verification code for Visa, Discover, Mastercard, or American Express transactions.

cvv_code.description: The card verification value code for for Visa, Discover, Mastercard, or American Express.

response_code.description: Processor response code for the non-PayPal payment processor errors.

payment_advice_code.description: The declined payment transactions might have payment advice codes. The card networks, like Visa and Mastercard, return payment advice codes.

card_verification_details.title: Card Verification Details
card_verification_details.description: Card Verification details including the authorization details and 3D SECURE details.

network_transaction_id.description: Transaction Identifier as given by the network to indicate a previously executed CIT authorization. Only present when authorization is successful for a verification.

time.description: The date and time when the instrument was verified.

amount.description: The amount used for card verification.

card_response.title: Card Response
card_response.description: Full representation of a Card Payment Token.

name.description: The card holder's name as it appears on the card.

last_digits.description: The last digits of the payment card.

brand.description: The card brand or network. Typically used in the response.

expiry.description: The card expiration year and month, in [Internet date format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

billing_address.description: The billing address for this card. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

country_code.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

address_portable.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)
address_portable.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as `next to Walmart`, or a landmark in an Indian address.

admin_area_4.description:
The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_3` or `sub_locality`. Value is:
  • The postal sorting code for Guernsey and many French territories, such as French Guiana.
  • The fine-grained administrative levels in China.

admin_area_3.description:
A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_2`. Value is:
  • Brazil. Suburb, bairro, or neighborhood.
  • India. Sub-locality or district. Street name information is not always available but a sub-locality or district can be a very small area.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

address_details.title: Address Details
address_details.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.

street_name.description: The street name. Just `Drury` in `Drury Lane`.

street_type.description: The street type. For example, avenue, boulevard, road, or expressway.

delivery_service.description: The delivery service. Post office box, bag number, or post office name.

building_name.description: A named locations that represents the premise. Usually a building name or number or collection of buildings with a common name or number. For example, Craven House.

sub_building.description: The first-order entity below a named building or location that represents the sub-premises. Usually a single building within a collection of buildings with a common name. Can be a flat, story, floor, room, or apartment.

name.description: The name of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `full_name` property.

type.description: The method by which the payer wants to get their items from the payee e.g shipping, in-person pickup. Either type or options but not both may be present.

address.description: The address of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

wallet_base.title: Vaulted Digital Wallet Common Attributes
wallet_base.description: Resource consolidating common request and response attributes for vaulting a Digital Wallet.

description.description: The description displayed to the consumer on the approval flow for a digital wallet, as well as on the merchant view of the payment token management experience. exp: PayPal.com.

shipping.description: The shipping address for the Payer.

permit_multiple_payment_tokens.description: Create multiple payment tokens for the same payer, merchant/platform combination. Use this when the customer has not logged in at merchant/platform. The payment token thus generated, can then also be used to create the customer account at merchant/platform. Use this also when multiple payment tokens are required for the same payer, different customer at merchant/platform. This helps to identify customers distinctly even though they may share the same PayPal account. This only applies to PayPal payment source.

usage_type.description: The usage type associated with a digital wallet payment token.

customer_type.description: The customer type associated with a digital wallet payment token. This is to indicate whether the customer acting on the merchant / platform is either a business or a consumer.

email.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

account_id.title: PayPal Account Identifier
account_id.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account.

payer_base.title: Payer Base
payer_base.description: The customer who approves and pays for the order. The customer is also known as the payer.

email_address.description: The email address of the payer.

payer_id.description: The PayPal-assigned ID for the payer.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Supports only the `national_number` property.

date_no_time.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.

tax_info.description: The tax ID of the customer. The customer is also known as the payer. Both `tax_id` and `tax_id_type` are required.
tax_info.title: Tax Information

payer.title: Customer
payer.description: The customer who approves and pays for the order. The customer is also known as the payer.

name.description: The name of the payer. Supports only the `given_name` and `surname` properties.

phone.description: The phone number of the customer. Available only when you enable the **Contact Telephone Number** option in the **Profile & Settings** for the merchant's PayPal account. The `phone.phone_number` supports only `national_number`.

birth_date.description: The birth date of the payer in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

tax_info.description: The tax information of the payer. Required only for Brazilian payer's. Both `tax_id` and `tax_id_type` are required.

address.description: The address of the payer. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties. Also referred to as the billing address of the customer.

paypal_wallet_response.title: PayPal Wallet Response
paypal_wallet_response.description: Full representation of a PayPal Payment Token.

account_id.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account.

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

venmo_response.title: Venmo Response
venmo_response.description: Full representation of a Venmo Payment Token.

user_name.description: The Venmo username, as chosen by the user.

card_type.title: Card Type
card_type.description: Type of card. i.e Credit, Debit and so on.

card.title: Card
card.description: The payment card to use to fund a payment. Can be a credit or debit card.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the card.

name.description: The card holder's name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The primary account number (PAN) for the payment card.

expiry.description: The card expiration year and month, in [Internet date format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

security_code.description: The three- or four-digit security code of the card. Also known as the CVV, CVC, CVN, CVE, or CID. This parameter cannot be present in the request when `payment_initiator=MERCHANT`.

last_digits.description: The last digits of the payment card.

card_type.description: The card brand or network. Typically used in the response.

brand.description: The card brand or network. Typically used in the response.

billing_address.description: The billing address for this card. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

apple_pay_card.title: Apple Pay Card
apple_pay_card.description: The payment card to be used to fund a payment. Can be a credit or debit card.

apple_pay_payment_token_response.title: Apple Pay Response
apple_pay_payment_token_response.description: A resource representing a response for Apple Pay.

card.description: Card data for the card linked to the apple pay token.

ach_debit_response-2.title: ACH Debit Response
ach_debit_response-2.description: A Resource representing a response of vaulted a ACH Debit Account.

bank_response.title: Bank Response
bank_response.description: Full representation of a Bank Payment Token.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

payment_token_response.title: Payment Token Response
payment_token_response.description: Full representation of a saved payment token.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the vault token.

customer.description: Customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

customer_vault_payment_tokens_response.title: Vault of a customer
customer_vault_payment_tokens_response.description: Collection of payment tokens saved for a given customer.

items.description: Each token in this collection represents a payment token.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details about the error.

card_verification_method.title: Card Verification Method
card_verification_method.description: The verification method of the card.

language.description: The [language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-2) for the language in which to localize the error-related strings, such as messages, issues, and suggested actions. The tag is made up of the [ISO 639-2 language code](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php), the optional [ISO-15924 script tag](https://www.unicode.org/iso15924/codelists.html), and the [ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) or [M49 region code](https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/).

vault_instruction.title: Vault Instruction
vault_instruction.description: Vault Instruction on action to be performed after a successful payer approval.

experience_context.title: Experience Context
experience_context.description: Customizes the Vault creation flow experience for your customers.

brand_name.description: The label that overrides the business name in the PayPal account on the PayPal site. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

locale.description: The BCP 47-formatted locale of pages that the PayPal vaulting experience shows. PayPal supports a five-character code. For example, `DA-DK`, `HE-IL`, `ID-ID`, `JA-JP`, `NO-NO`, `PT-BR`, `RU-RU`, `SV-SE`, `TH-TH`, `ZH-CN`, `ZH-HK`, or `ZH-TW`.

return_url.description: The URL where the customer is redirected after customer approves leaves the flow. It is a required field for contingency flows like PayPal wallet, 3DS.

cancel_url.description: The URL where the customer is redirected after customer cancels or leaves the flow. It is a required field for contingency flows like PayPal wallet, 3DS.

shipping_preference.description: The shipping preference. This only applies to PayPal payment source.

vault_instruction.description: Vault Instruction on action to be performed after a successful payer approval.

card_request.title: Card Request
card_request.description: A Resource representing a request to vault a Card.

verification_method.description: The API caller can opt in to verify the payment token through PayPal offered verification services (e.g. Smart Dollar Auth, 3DS).

token_id_request.title: Token Request
token_id_request.description: The Tokenized Payment Source representing a Request to Vault a Token.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the token.

type.description: The tokenization method that generated the ID.

attributes.description: The auxiliary details of the token.

payment_token_request.title: Payment Token Request
payment_token_request.description: Payment Token Request where the `source` defines the type of instrument to be stored.

customer.description: Customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

payment_source.title: Payment source request
payment_source.description: The payment method to vault with the instrument details.

paypal_wallet_request.title: PayPal Wallet Request
paypal_wallet_request.description: A resource representing a request to vault PayPal Wallet.

venmo_request.title: Venmo Request
venmo_request.description: A resource representing a request to vault Venmo.

setup_token_request.title: Setup Token
setup_token_request.description: Setup Token Request where the `source` defines the type of instrument to be stored.

customer.description: Customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

payment_source.description: The payment method to vault with the instrument details.

payment_token_status.title: Payment Token Status
payment_token_status.description: The status of the payment token.

setup_token_response.title: Minimal Setup Token
setup_token_response.description: Minimal representation of a cached setup token.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the vault token.

ordinal.description: The ordinal number of customers' payment source for sorting.

customer.description: Customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

status.description: The status of the payment token.

paypal.description: Description for PayPal to be shown to PayPal payer

venmo.description: Description for Venmo to be shown to Venmo payer
